data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كُنْتَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: (root of nabi) to be high, lofty, become exalted/elevated, to aquaint/inform, utter in a low voice/sound, cry, bark, gift of prophecy, prophet.To come/go forth, to assault/come upon, went forth, brought/produce.Information; a piece of information; intellegence; an announcement; news; tidings; a piece of news; an account; a narrative, or narration; a story (something that is related from one to another). An announcement of great utility, from which results either knowledge or a predominance of opinion, and true.Eminence/protuberence in the ground/earth.An evident/clear way.Bull, a torrent that comes forth from another land, a man coming forth unexpectedly from an unknown quarter.
data.sentence: The word أَنْبَاءِ comes from the root ن ب ا and is associated with the meanings: (root of nabi) to be high, lofty, become exalted/elevated, to aquaint/inform, utter in a low voice/sound, cry, bark, gift of prophecy, prophet.To come/go forth, to assault/come upon, went forth, brought/produce.Information; a piece of information; intellegence; an announcement; news; tidings; a piece of news; an account; a narrative, or narration; a story (something that is related from one to another). An announcement of great utility, from which results either knowledge or a predominance of opinion, and true.Eminence/protuberence in the ground/earth.An evident/clear way.Bull, a torrent that comes forth from another land, a man coming forth unexpectedly from an unknown quarter.

data.meanings: absent/remote/hidden/concealed, absent from the range or beyond the reach of perception by sense or of mental perception, unseen/invisible.
data.sentence: The word الْغَيْبِ comes from the root غ ي ب and is associated with the meanings: absent/remote/hidden/concealed, absent from the range or beyond the reach of perception by sense or of mental perception, unseen/invisible.
The word لَدَيْهِمْ comes from the root ل د ي and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To meet, meet with, encounter, find, find out a thing, see, come across, experience, suffer from, occur, undergo, endure, lean upon, recieve, come face to face, go in the direction of or towards.This root has occurred in al quran in 45 forms, and been used about 145 times.
data.sentence: The word يُلْقُونَ comes from the root ل ق ي and is associated with the meanings: To meet, meet with, encounter, find, find out a thing, see, come across, experience, suffer from, occur, undergo, endure, lean upon, recieve, come face to face, go in the direction of or towards.This root has occurred in al quran in 45 forms, and been used about 145 times.

data.meanings: to cut, pierce. qalam - pen, headless arrow used in casting lots.
data.sentence: The word أَقْلَامَهُمْ comes from the root ق ل م and is associated with the meanings: to cut, pierce. qalam - pen, headless arrow used in casting lots.

data.meanings: sign, apparent sign, mark, indication, message, evidence, proof, miracle, communication, verse of The Quran. It properly signifies any apparent thing inseparable from a thing not equally apparent so that when one perceives the former, he perceives the other which he cannot perceive by itself.
data.sentence: The word أَيُّهُمْ comes from the root ا ي ي and is associated with the meanings: sign, apparent sign, mark, indication, message, evidence, proof, miracle, communication, verse of The Quran. It properly signifies any apparent thing inseparable from a thing not equally apparent so that when one perceives the former, he perceives the other which he cannot perceive by itself.

data.meanings: To take care of, nourish, bring up for another, be guardian of, be responsible for, entrust, stand security or surety.
data.sentence: The word يَكْفُلُ comes from the root ك ف ل and is associated with the meanings: To take care of, nourish, bring up for another, be guardian of, be responsible for, entrust, stand security or surety.

data.meanings: Contend in an altercation, dispute/litigate in a sound or valid manner, to say a thing such as may cause the listener to refrain/desist from his assertion/plea/claim, overcome someone in an altercation, antagonize, put a thing on the edge/side or corner of something.
data.sentence: The word يَخْتَصِمُونَ comes from the root خ ص م and is associated with the meanings: Contend in an altercation, dispute/litigate in a sound or valid manner, to say a thing such as may cause the listener to refrain/desist from his assertion/plea/claim, overcome someone in an altercation, antagonize, put a thing on the edge/side or corner of something.
